translations.name: Quaker(Purver) Bible
translations.description: The Quaker Bible, which is officially called A new and literal translation of all the books of the Old and New Testament; with notes critical and explanatory, is the 1764 translation of the Old and New Testaments into English by the Quaker theologian Anthony Purver. A portion of Purver's translation was published in parts about 1742 by Felix Farley in Bristol. Later, the translation was published in two Volumes in London by W. Richardson and S. Clark in 1764, but is not generally regarded as successful.
